Class PolyFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • Function
      • PolyFunc

  • public class PolyFunc
extends Function
    This class uses the evaluate() methods to return the results of any given polynomial(Ex: {1,-2,3} = 3x^2-2x+1).
    Since:
    2/13/2018

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] xnumber
      Initial int array to store the values of x^number, or the coefficients of x.

      • Fields inherited from class Function

        epsilon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PolyFunc(int[] coefficients)
      Constructor for an array of coefficients

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Poly add(Poly a)
      Constructor to add two polynomails Ex:(2x^5 + 3x^4 - 8x^2 + 4) + (x^3 + 4x^2 - 2x) = (2x^5 + 3x^4 + x^3 - 4x^2 - 2x + 4).
      int degree()
      Constructor to return the power of the highest non-zero term
      double evaluate(double x)
      Constructor to return the value of the function at the point x Ex: If Poly object represents 2x^5+3x^4-8x^2+4 and evaluate(2.0) is called the method should calculate 2(2)^5+3(2)^4-8(2)^2+4 and return 84
      int polyLength()
      Constructor for the length of each polynomial
      java.lang.String toString()
      Constructor to override the Objects class's toString method returns a String representation of the polynomial using x as the variable arranged in decreasing order of exponent printing nothing with a zero coefficient Ex: [4,0,-8,0,3,2] returns: 2x^5+3x^4-8x^2+4

      • Methods inherited from class Function

        findRoot, main

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • polyLength

        public int polyLength()
        Constructor for the length of each polynomial
        Returns:
        this.xnumber.length The length of the given array

      • degree

        public int degree()
        Constructor to return the power of the highest non-zero term
        Returns:
        this.xnumber.length-1 Returns the highest degree polynomial

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Constructor to override the Objects class's toString method returns a String representation of the polynomial using x as the variable arranged in decreasing order of exponent printing nothing with a zero coefficient Ex: [4,0,-8,0,3,2] returns: 2x^5+3x^4-8x^2+4
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        stringbuild.toString() The StringBuilder will use its functionality to return the polynomial as a string

      • add

        public Poly add(Poly a)
        Constructor to add two polynomails Ex:(2x^5 + 3x^4 - 8x^2 + 4) + (x^3 + 4x^2 - 2x) = (2x^5 + 3x^4 + x^3 - 4x^2 - 2x + 4).
        Parameters:
        a - A polynomial used to be added from the object
        Returns:
        myPolyFunc A new polynomial that has resulted in adding the two polynomials together

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(double x)
        Constructor to return the value of the function at the point x Ex: If Poly object represents 2x^5+3x^4-8x^2+4 and evaluate(2.0) is called the method should calculate 2(2)^5+3(2)^4-8(2)^2+4 and return 84
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class Function
        Parameters:
        x - The variable that will be passed in to evaluate the polynomial
        Returns:
        total The total value of the polynomial when given a specific number
